reasoning: HELLP syndrome (Hemolysis, Elevated Liver enzymes, Low Platelets) occurs in 0.2-0.6% of pregnancies globally. Using 0.4% prevalence in pregnancies (~135 million births annually = ~540,000 cases), extrapolated to ~5.4 per 100k global population. Data from obstetrics literature shows strong epidemiological characterization.
source: Sibai BM. HELLP syndrome. J Matern Fetal Neonatal Med. 2009;22(7):619-628; American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists Clinical Guidelines
